                "import UIKit\nclass MyCustomView: UIView {\n\n    override init(frame: CGRect) {\n        super.init(frame: frame)\n        setup()\n    }\n\n    required init?(coder aDecoder: NSCoder) {\n        super.init(coder: aDecoder)\n        setup()\n    }\n    \n    func setup() {\n        \n        // Create a CAShapeLayer\n        let shapeLayer = CAShapeLayer()\n        \n        // The Bezier path that we made needs to be converted to \n        // a CGPath before it can be used on a layer.\n        shapeLayer.path = createBezierPath().CGPath\n        \n        // apply other properties related to the path\n        shapeLayer.strokeColor = UIColor.blueColor().CGColor\n        shapeLayer.fillColor = UIColor.whiteColor().CGColor\n        shapeLayer.lineWidth = 1.0\n        shapeLayer.position = CGPoint(x: 10, y: 10)\n        \n        // add the new layer to our custom view\n        self.layer.addSublayer(shapeLayer)\n    }\n\n    func createBezierPath() -\u003e UIBezierPath {\n        \n        // see previous code for creating the Bezier path\n    }\n}"
              ]
            ]

      "727332ec-b0b3-4df3-ab41-62ade2da87e7": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1550396879354,
          "id": "727332ec-b0b3-4df3-ab41-62ade2da87e7",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1550396879354,
          "parent_id": "bc85840c-cc42-483f-8fa4-fe3e2a78c27c",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [
              [
                "Plain Text"
              ]
            ],
            "title": [
              [
                "func createBezierPath() -\u003e UIBezierPath {\n    \n    // create a new path\n    let path = UIBezierPath()\n    \n    // starting point for the path (bottom left)\n    path.moveToPoint(CGPoint(x: 2, y: 26))\n    \n    // *********************\n    // ***** Left side *****\n    // *********************\n    \n    // segment 1: line\n    path.addLineToPoint(CGPoint(x: 2, y: 15))\n    \n    // segment 2: curve\n    path.addCurveToPoint(CGPoint(x: 0, y: 12), // ending point\n        controlPoint1: CGPoint(x: 2, y: 14),\n        controlPoint2: CGPoint(x: 0, y: 14))\n    \n    // segment 3: line\n    path.addLineToPoint(CGPoint(x: 0, y: 2))\n    \n    // *********************\n    // ****** Top side *****\n    // *********************\n    \n    // segment 4: arc\n    path.addArcWithCenter(CGPoint(x: 2, y: 2), // center point of circle\n        radius: 2, // this will make it meet our path line\n        startAngle: CGFloat(M_PI), // π radians = 180 degrees = straight left\n        endAngle: CGFloat(3*M_PI_2), // 3π/2 radians = 270 degrees = straight up\n        clockwise: true) // startAngle to endAngle goes in a clockwise direction\n    \n    // segment 5: line\n    path.addLineToPoint(CGPoint(x: 8, y: 0))\n    \n    // segment 6: arc\n    path.addArcWithCenter(CGPoint(x: 8, y: 2),\n        radius: 2,\n        startAngle: CGFloat(3*M_PI_2), // straight up\n        endAngle: CGFloat(0), // 0 radians = straight right\n        clockwise: true)\n    \n    // *********************\n    // ***** Right side ****\n    // *********************\n    \n    // segment 7: line\n    path.addLineToPoint(CGPoint(x: 10, y: 12))\n    \n    // segment 8: curve\n    path.addCurveToPoint(CGPoint(x: 8, y: 15), // ending point\n        controlPoint1: CGPoint(x: 10, y: 14),\n        controlPoint2: CGPoint(x: 8, y: 14))\n    \n    // segment 9: line\n    path.addLineToPoint(CGPoint(x: 8, y: 26))\n    \n    // *********************\n    // **** Bottom side ****\n    // *********************\n    \n    // segment 10: line\n    path.closePath() // draws the final line to close the path\n    \n    return path\n}"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

                "import UIKit\nclass MyCustomView: UIView {\n    \n    override func drawRect(rect: CGRect) {\n        \n        // create path (see previous code)\n        let path = createBezierPath()\n        \n        // fill\n        let fillColor = UIColor.whiteColor()\n        fillColor.setFill()\n        \n        // stroke\n        path.lineWidth = 1.0\n        let strokeColor = UIColor.blueColor()\n        strokeColor.setStroke()\n        \n        // Move the path to a new location\n        path.applyTransform(CGAffineTransformMakeTranslation(10, 10))\n        \n        // fill and stroke the path (always do these last)\n        path.fill()\n        path.stroke()\n        \n    }\n    \n    func createBezierPath() -\u003e UIBezierPath {\n        \n        // see previous code for creating the Bezier path\n    }\n}"
